content: will be picking up six stitches per inch knit 10 row slipping the first stitch of each row knitwise after the first row cast off knitwise using a slightly smaller needle to stop the edge flaring i used a 3 mm straight needle for this now work the border on the opposite side of the blanket in exactly the same way the last two borders will have 12 more stitches as you will need to pick up six stitches across the sides of the existing borders giving you a pleasing total of 222 stitches once all the borders are added you can darn in the yarn tails and block your blanket ta-dah abbreviations there are no abbreviations - i told you it was a simple pattern © frankie brown 2021 mypatterns areforpersonaluseonlyandshouldnotbeusedtoknititems forsale pleasedonotusethemforteachingpurposes withoutmypermission
